summary: "The Ten Commandments" is a 1956 American movie directed by Cecil B. DeMille about the biblical story of Moses. Based on several books and the Book of Exodus, it stars Charlton Heston as Moses, who leads the enslaved Hebrews to freedom after receiving God's laws at Mount Sinai. Filmed in Egypt and the Sinai Peninsula, it was DeMille's most successful film and won an Academy Award for Best Visual Effects. The movie was also nominated for Best Picture and received various other awards and nominations for its stars. It remains one of the most successful films ever, both critically and financially.
title: The Ten Commandments (1956 film)
